newsitem.title: UK: Britannia Building Society yr pretax rises.
newsitem.headline: Britannia Building Society yr pretax rises.

text.p: Britain's Britannia Building Society on Thursday said it had pretax profits of 108.7 million stg in 1996 before distribution of a 35 million stg profit share payment to its members.
After the distribution and 2.0 million stg in associated costs, pretax profits for the society were 71.7 million stg compared with 112.7 million stg in 1995.
With the acquisition of a Citibank mortgage portfolio late in the year, mortgage assets under management grew to 10 billion stg from 8.7 billion, the building society said in a statement.
Under Britannia's Loyalty Bonus Scheme, launched a year ago, members earn points for their time with the society. At the end of each year, the points are converted into cash.
The firm said the profit share payments "were the clearest possible demonstration of Britannia's commitment to remaining a mutual society -- owned by its members and operated for their benefit".
The future of Britain's building societies has been the subject of intense speculation ahead of Halifax Building Society's planned conversion into a public company later this year.
